title: Former Bond actor's family back new writer Phoebe Waller-Bridge for success

New Bond 25 writer Phoebe Waller-Bridge has got a licence to thrill, according to Sir Roger Moore’s family.

The 34-year-old – who also penned the first series of Killing Eve – has taken on the tough task of modernising the script for the highly anticipated upcoming blockbuster No Time to Die.

Roger was one of the most ­memorable 007s, taking on the role between 1973 and 1985. He died in 2017.

And Roger’s son Geoffrey tells me: “Killing Eve is terrific. She will most definitely be a great addition to the film.”

Phoebe was hired by director Barbara Broccoli, and Geoffrey adds: “She has got such a good nose for these things. She knows it so well.

“No one can talk her out of ­everything and she has proved to be right every time. My dad was so supportive to Barbara and her choice and she always got it right. He was a fan of Daniel Craig who is a great ­reflection of our times.

“They have done such a good job to keep the franchise going.”

Roger’s family are releasing a new single U.N.I (You & I) in his memory to raise money for UNICEF.

It stars over 50 global celebrities including Joanna Lumley, David Walliams , Will Poulter and Dame Joan Collins.

And Geoffrey, 53, hopes the record could become a Bond theme tune. He adds: “It would be great if they played it in the film.” Watch this space...
description: EXCLUSIVE: Roger Moore's son Geoffrey is convinced the Killing Eve and Fleabag writer will be a great addition to the James Bond franchise
